tutorialSteps.title: Multiprotocol application
tutorialSteps.content: A multiprotocol application is able to mix both Matter and Zigbee endpoints into a single application. These endpoints are the same as the usual ones you encountered in a single protocol application. If you are not familiar with them, I suggest to try the Endpoints tutorial first

tutorialSteps.title: Multiprotocol application
tutorialSteps.content: Let's start with adding a new endpoint to your application by clicking ADD NEW ENDPOINT in the top left corner of the ZCL Advanced Platform (ZAP) interface.

tutorialSteps.title: Creating a root node
tutorialSteps.content: Selecting the Matter root node from the list.

tutorialSteps.title: Creating a root node
tutorialSteps.content: Once you have configured the endpoint, click CREATE to add the endpoint to your configuration.

tutorialSteps.content: Now let's add a matter endpoint.

tutorialSteps.content: Now let's add a zigbee endpoint.

tutorialSteps.title: Adding a zigbee endpoint
tutorialSteps.content: Its important to set this device to the same Device ID as the matter one (1 in this case).

tutorialSteps.title: Adding a zigbee endpoint
tutorialSteps.content: Selecting a Zigbee device from the list.

tutorialSteps.title: Adding a zigbee endpoint
tutorialSteps.content: Once you have configured the endpoint, click CREATE to add the endpoint to your configuration.
Now we can check the endpoints attributes where we can find mixed from both type.

The Show dropdown shows all the available clusters for a certain endpoint. Selecting the Enabled Clusters option will display only clusters enabled on the endpoint which going to be both Matter and Zigbee in this case.
There you can find the Basic attribute on this zigbee endpoint which should be matter only.
